page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT in RHAYADER
page.content: Rhayader is isolated from the main industrial areas,is not near a motor- way and is,therefore,not considered viable by most industries.Light industry encouraged by the Mid-Wales Development Board include a firm making paper files and employing 90% women together with other single unit workshops.These workshops usually only only employ 2-5 people and change hands often once the various induce- ments offered by the Development Board are finished.There is also a factory making high-speed,precision gearboxes for aerospace,industry and M.O.D.use which employs 60.Tourism generates a large proportion of jobs particularly in the summer months. Apart from shops which generally only employ part-time workers and farming the other main employer is Local Government with most employees working out of the area.
